roleset.name: (cause to) spew forth, spewing forth
roleset.note: ERUPT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'erupt' based on sentences in wsj and automaticexpansion via verbnet. (from erupt.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: straight unaccusative
example.text: On so-called Manic Monday, Oct. 16, stock prices plunged across Europe and trading problems erupted.

example.name: misplaced modifier
example.text: A bitter conflict with global implications has erupted between Nomura Securities Co. and Industrial Bank of Japan, two of the world's most powerful financial companies.
example.arg: A bitter conflict with global implications
between Nomura Securities Co. and Industrial Bank of Japan, two of the world's most powerful financial companies

example.name: with substance
example.text: The Senate's public gallery was packed with Judge Hastings' supporters, who *trace* erupted into applause after he finished his argument.

example.name: Arg0
example.text: The eruption of Krakatoa began in May 1883 and culminated with the destruction of Krakatoa on 27 August 1883.

roleset.name: mode of speaking
roleset.note: ERUPT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'erupt' based on sentences in wsj and automaticexpansion via verbnet. (from erupt.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: blow your top
example.text: And Mancuso himself is investigating at the top of his lungs: [``How the hell can you live with yourself?'']-1 he erupts *trace*-1 at a politician.
